alert.note: Alert for Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 9:28PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following county, Saginaw. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 928 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - After a brief hiatus of rain, a new storm system will bring additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches over the next hour. This additional rain will result in continued minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chesaning, St. Charles and Oakley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
